text: Is there a sample for using Transaction Certificate on chaincode?
<@U11TAFPUP>: i think the support is still emerging, but you can get a taste here: <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/pull/1212>

attachments.title: Example of a chaincode using role-based access control (RBAC) by adecaro · Pull Request #1212 · hyperledger/fabric · GitHub
attachments.text: The PR contains a chaincode showing how to implement role-based access control using TCerts. This addresses Issue #1207. Signed-off-by: Angelo De Caro <mailto:adc@zurich.ibm.com|adc@zurich.ibm.com>
attachments.fallback: GitHub: Example of a chaincode using role-based access control (RBAC) by adecaro · Pull Request #1212 · hyperledger/fabric

text: <@U11TAFPUP> - you can start with the example <@U0KPFAZNF> mentions and they'll be some updates coming soon as well as documentation on how this all works and the relevant APIs provided by the fabric.  This will also become more clear when the Client SDK is completed as you'll actually have more control of TCerts so you can get a better idea how things works

but the basic idea is that the fabric provides a set of APIs in the chaincode shim which allows you to interrogate TCerts for various attributes which you can then use within your chaincode to provide access control, assign owners to assets, etc
<@U0UFDAS91>: Hi Chris, if there is call-in information for the meeting tomorrow, would you mind posting a link to that here?  Thanks.
